title: Protip from a support main: If you don't buy sightstone you are holding your team back.
body:
If you don't buy a sightstone and the enemy support does, they are going to outright butt-fondle you in the vision war. Also bear in mind that when a support buys a sightstone they are actually getting TWO sight items, which is the sightstone and the sweeper, while you are still stuck with your one garbage yellow trinket wondering why your team keeps getting caught.

If the enemy team knows how to play a video game then vision is going to be way more important than your 40 AP blasting wand. Sorry but that's just how it is.

Time for a history lesson. When the game first came out, it was pretty chaotic, and you could play any champion in any role and be successful because few people had to knowledge required to counter pick. Then, as people started realising the value of farm, they  started assigning themselves dedicated lanes to farm in. But oh no, there are more players than lanes, better have someone dedicated to farming the jungle so the team has more gold. And so the role of jungler developed. 

But there were still 3 lanes and 4 players, so it was clear that there would not  be enough income to sustain 4 carry champions, so someone would have to go without farm and try and help the team as much as possible without carrying by damage. And so the role of support developed.

Now which type of character would benefit most from having this support lane with them? Tanks don't need to be supported because they are more valuable for their utility. Mages can't be supported because splitting the exp would put them behind in lvls and therefore make their abilities do less dmg. However, marksmen are perfect candidates for being supported, because they rely predominantly on gold and not on levels, because they do most of their damage with autos. And so the support/ADC combo was developed. This duo lane was assigned bot lane because it is closest to dragon and therefore can have most impact on dragon fights.

The association with mid lane and high damage carries is simply because mid is (obviously) the central lane, so these carries can have most impact on the entire map. They also get a slight level advantage (which therefore makes their abilities do more damage) because the minions reach mid lane faster. And so the roles of carry midlaners developed.

Now look at top lane. Before herald, there was nothing of any importance on that side of the map, so you were unlikely to receive any help from your team due to the lost pressure on bot lane/dragon if the jungler was to come top. Therefore top laners need to be champions that are able to survive on their own with little assistance from their team. This means is was unreliable to play any carries top, because if you fell behind your team would be unable to help and you would be useless. It was therefore logical that top laners would be champions that do not require much gold to operate and would still be useful to their team (through utility/peel) if they fell behind. And so tanky and bruiser champions were played top.

I'm  not entirely sure why I wrote all this out, but I guess I just wanted to demonstrate how the pros didn't just pick lane numbers out of a hat and decide to role with it. There is a reason this meta has existed for 5+ years and not seen any major changes, and that's because this meta is logical and optimal.

Someone made an interesting comment on this subject on a different thread. THe gist of the point was that a support's job is not to ward. A support's job is to support, whatever that may consist of. So while every half-decent support agrees that SS is vital (borderline: mandatory), we may not rush it as our first complete item. In laning phase, if we aren't seeing much jungle activity near us and there's a specific support item that would make my ADC's laning phase substantially better or keep us both alive you can be damn sure I'm going to rush that.

Once the laning phase has ended SS becomes mandatory. Before that, when supports aren't roaming as much and are primarily babysitting the ADC, the priority is whatever keeps bot team alive and helps get the ADC CS/kills and/or tower takedowns. With good map awareness and minimal communication about warding, bot team's two yellow trinkets are enough to keep river decently warded against surprise visits.
